page.title: 14History of Education
page.content: Preston Board school opened its doors on 14th January 1878 with 17 girls and 19 boys. The Rev E Evers conducted prayers and then declared the school open. The first head was Mr A J Watkinson. He remained as head of the school for 42 years, retiring in 1920. During his years as head Mr Watkinson was responsible for the education of 2177 children. Many children then as now took time away from school for reasons not strictly legitimate - fruit and potato picking were favourite reasons for absence. Other heads, W G Bartlett, H R Skinner and H Verity left their mark on the old Board School transforming it into a modern day primay school in modern classrooms.
